body: Cool feature. It would be great if Serilog also provided a way to configure it in appSettings.json the same as the other log providers as in my issue https://github.com/aspnet/Logging/issues/437. I think the key is consistency, so that any logger can be configured in the same way.

issue.title: MinimumLevel.Override()
issue.body:
#754

``` csharp
var logger = new LoggerConfiguration()
    .MinimumLevel.Debug()
    .MinimumLevel.Override("Microsoft", LogEventLevel.Error)
    //
```

issue.title: Filter.ByExcluding is not working as expected
issue.body:
## I have following configuration:

 Log.Logger = new LoggerConfiguration()
                           .WriteTo.RollingFile(
                               Path.Combine(env.ContentRootPath + "\Logs", "log-{Date}.txt"),
                           LogEventLevel.Debug,
                           fileSizeLimitBytes: 10485760
                           ).Filter.ByExcluding(x=>x.MessageTemplate.Text.Contains("starting") || x.MessageTemplate.Text.Contains("finished"))
                           .WriteTo.LiterateConsole(LogEventLevel.Error)
##                            .CreateLogger();

It works perfectly fine except its not filtering the message based on the lambda expression. It only exclude the file word, it doesn't matter what ever you put in.

issue.title: Bug in overriding while lowering logging level
issue.body:
Hi. 

Tried to use #754 for our "buggy parts" of code. It seems that pipeline LogLevel ignores all overrides. Full test is in attachment. Code is below.

```
Log.Logger = new LoggerConfiguration()
    .MinimumLevel.Debug()
    .MinimumLevel.Override(nameof(SerilogTesting), LogEventLevel.Verbose)
    .WriteTo.LiterateConsole(outputTemplate: "[{Timestamp:HH:mm:ss} {Level} {SourceContext}] {Message}{NewLine}{Exception}")
    .CreateLogger();

Log.Logger.Verbose("A"); // <-- not printed, expected

Log.Logger.ForContext<Program>().Verbose("1"); // <-- not printed, NOT expected
```

[SerilogTesting.zip](https://github.com/serilog/serilog/files/377872/SerilogTesting.zip)

issue.title: Is It Possible to Reduce LogLevel For Controller Actions?
issue.body: I have an action that returns the status of my API which is polled by my load balancer very frequently. Is it possible to reduce the log level specifically for this action? If so, how could this be done?

issue.title: Add doc for serilog:minimum-level:override:
issue.body: Documents issue #2 (implemented by serilog/serilog#888) that supports serilog/serilog#754 from appsettings
